data_maturity_score.evidence: Heavy emphasis on legacy tools (GoAnywhere MFT, WinSCP), manual scripting processes, no modern data stack mentioned (no dbt, Airflow, Snowflake), no CI/CD or testing practices, suggests developing stage with basic automation but inconsistent practices

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 2 indicates developing stage - some automation and scripting present but focused on legacy file transfer rather than modern data engineering practices

maturity_signals.evidence: No modern data stack adoption, no CI/CD practices, no data quality testing, no monitoring/observability, no data governance mentioned - all traditional enterprise IT approach

scope_creep_score.evidence: Role combines data engineering with system administration (patching, updates), incident management, on-call duties, and compliance reporting - multiple distinct responsibilities beyond core DE work

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Explicitly requires 'after-hours and weekends on-call duties', incident management responsibilities, and immediate operational support needs suggest high likelihood of overtime and work-life balance issues

role_clarity.evidence: Combines data engineering with system administration, compliance, and operational support - not a focused data engineering role

strength_details: Transparent salary range ($80,000-$85,000) for Cincinnati market
Stable employment with established multinational corporation (TCS)
concern_details: Mandatory after-hours and weekend on-call duties create poor work-life balance
Role combines data engineering with system administration and compliance responsibilities
Heavy focus on legacy technologies (GoAnywhere MFT, WinSCP) rather than modern data stack
No career growth, learning opportunities, or advancement paths mentioned
No reporting structure or team information provided
Onsite requirement in Cincinnati with no remote flexibility
best_fit_details: Data engineers with 3-5 years experience seeking stable operational role
Professionals comfortable with legacy enterprise technologies and manual processes
Candidates prioritizing job stability over modern tech stack exposure
probe_details: Clarify on-call rotation schedule and compensation for after-hours/weekend work
Understand actual work hours and overtime expectations beyond on-call duties
Ask about team size, composition, and reporting structure
Inquire about career advancement and skill development opportunities
Understand scope boundaries between data engineering and system administration duties
leverage_details: Onsite requirement in Cincinnati gives advantage to local candidates who don't need relocation
Specific technical skills (GoAnywhere, Azure) may provide negotiation leverage for qualified candidates
summary.overall_assessment: Operational data engineering role focused on legacy file transfer systems at established IT services company. Stable employment with transparent compensation but significant concerns around work-life balance due to mandatory on-call duties, scope creep combining multiple responsibilities, and limited growth opportunities. Best suited for candidates prioritizing stability over modern tech exposure.
